</head>

<body>
    <div class="container">
        <div class="header">
            <div class="header-content">
                <div>
                    <h1>idlhub.com - API Documentation</h1>
                </div>
                <div class="nav-links">
                    <a href="index.html" class="nav-link">Home</a>
                    <a href="docs.html" class="nav-link">API</a>
                    <a href="https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub" target="_blank" class="nav-link">GitHub</a>
                    <button class="theme-btn" onclick="toggleTheme()">Theme</button>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="sidebar">
            <a href="#overview">Overview</a>
            <a href="#quick-start">Quick Start</a>
            <a href="#rest-api">REST API</a>
            <a href="#rest-auth">Authentication</a>
            <a href="#rest-endpoints">API Endpoints</a>
            <a href="#mcp-api">MCP API</a>
            <a href="#mcp-tools">MCP Tools</a>
            <a href="#mcp-integration">MCP Integration</a>
            <a href="#playground">API Playground</a>
            <a href="#examples">Code Examples</a>
        </div>

        <div class="main-content">
            <!-- Table of Contents for Mobile -->
            <div class="toc">
                <h3>Table of Contents</h3>
                <ul>
                    <li><a href="#overview">Overview</a></li>
                    <li><a href="#quick-start">Quick Start</a></li>
                    <li><a href="#rest-api">REST API</a></li>
                    <li><a href="#mcp-api">MCP API</a></li>
                    <li><a href="#playground">API Playground</a></li>
                    <li><a href="#examples">Code Examples</a></li>
                </ul>
            </div>

            <!-- Overview Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="overview">
                <h2>Overview</h2>
                <p>
                    IDLHub is a comprehensive, searchable registry of Interface Definition Language (IDL) files for
                    Solana protocols. It provides both a web interface and programmatic access via REST and MCP APIs.
                </p>

                <div class="feature-grid">
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸ“‹ Comprehensive Coverage</h4>
                        <p>IDLs for 100+ Solana protocols including Jupiter, Orca, Marinade, Drift, Kamino, and many
                            more.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸŒ Web Interface</h4>
                        <p>Simple, intuitive web UI for searching, browsing, and exporting protocol IDLs.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸ”Œ REST API</h4>
                        <p>Complete REST API for loading, uploading, and managing IDL files dynamically.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸ¤– MCP Server</h4>
                        <p>Model Context Protocol server for LLM and editor integration with schema lookup and code
                            generation.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸ” Semantic Search</h4>
                        <p>Powered by Qdrant vector database for intelligent protocol discovery.</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="feature-card">
                        <h4>ğŸ’» Code Generation</h4>
                        <p>Generate TypeScript, Rust, Python, and Anchor TS code from IDL schemas.</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>

            <!-- Quick Start Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="quick-start">
                <h2>Quick Start</h2>

                <h3>Web Interface</h3>
                <p>Visit <a href="index.html">idlhub.com</a> to browse and export IDLs using the web interface:</p>
                <ol>
                    <li>Search for protocols by name or description</li>
                    <li>Filter by category (DEX, Lending, Derivatives, etc.)</li>
                    <li>Select protocols you're interested in</li>
                    <li>Click "Export Selected IDLs" to download them</li>
                </ol>

                <h3>Programmatic Access</h3>
                <pre><code>// Load the registry index
const response = await fetch('https://idlhub.com/index.json');
const registry = await response.json();

// Find a specific protocol
const jupiter = registry.protocols.find(p => p.id === 'jupiter');

// Load its IDL
const idlResponse = await fetch(`https://idlhub.com/${jupiter.idlPath}`);
const idl = await idlResponse.json();</code></pre>

                <h3>MCP Server Installation</h3>
                <pre><code># One-line install
curl -fsSL https://idlhub.com/mcp | sh

# Or manual install
git clone https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub.git
cd idlhub
npm install
npm run mcp:start</code></pre>

                <h3>REST API Server Setup</h3>
                <p>To run the REST API server locally, follow these steps:</p>
                <pre><code># Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub.git
cd idlhub

# Install dependencies (REQUIRED)
npm install

# Start the API server
npm run api:start

# The server will be available at http://localhost:3000</code></pre>
                <p style="font-size: 12px; color: var(--text-muted); margin-top: 8px;">
                    <strong>Important:</strong> You must run <code>npm install</code> before starting the API server. 
                    The server requires Express, Axios, CORS, and other dependencies to run.
                </p>
            </div>

            <!-- REST API Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="rest-api">
                <h2>REST API</h2>
                <p>
                    The IDLHub REST API provides endpoints for dynamically loading, uploading, and managing Solana
                    program IDL files.
                </p>

                <h4>Base URL</h4>
                <p>
                    For local development: <code>http://localhost:3000</code>
                </p>
                <p style="font-size: 12px; color: var(--text-muted); background: var(--bg-tertiary); padding: 12px; border-left: 3px solid var(--accent-primary); margin: 16px 0;">
                    <strong>âš ï¸ Important:</strong> The REST API server must be deployed separately. 
                    The static site at <code>https://idlhub.com</code> does not include a backend API server.
                    All example commands and "Try It Live" buttons require a running API server at <code>http://localhost:3000</code>.
                    See the <a href="#quick-start" style="color: var(--accent-primary);">REST API Server Setup</a> section above for installation instructions.
                </p>

                <h3 id="rest-auth">Authentication</h3>
                <p>
                    Currently, the API is open and does not require authentication. For production use, consider adding
                    API key authentication.
                </p>

                <h3 id="rest-endpoints">API Endpoints</h3>

                <div class="endpoint">
                    <div>
                        <span class="endpoint-method get">GET</span>
                        <span class="endpoint-path">/health</span>
                    </div>
                    <p style="margin-top: 12px;">Check if the API server is running.</p>
                    <h4>Example Request:</h4>
                    <pre><code>curl http://localhost:3000/health</code></pre>
                    <h4>Example Response:</h4>
                    <pre><code>{
  "status": "ok",
  "timestamp": "2025-12-10T10:00:00.000Z",
  "version": "1.0.0"
}</code></pre>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/health', null)" style="margin-top: 12px;">ğŸš€ Try It Live</button>
                </div>

                <div class="endpoint">
                    <div>
                        <span class="endpoint-method get">GET</span>
                        <span class="endpoint-path">/api/all</span>
                    </div>
                    <p style="margin-top: 12px;">Get all IDLs in the registry.</p>
                    <h4>Example Request:</h4>
                    <pre><code>curl http://localhost:3000/api/all</code></pre>
                    <h4>Example Response:</h4>
                    <pre><code>{
  "total": 15,
  "idls": [
    {
      "name": "jupiter",
      "version": "0.1.0",
      "description": "Jupiter Aggregator - The key liquidity aggregator for Solana",
      "category": "dex-aggregator",
      "idl": {...}
    }
  ]
}</code></pre>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/api/all', null)" style="margin-top: 12px;">ğŸš€ Try It Live</button>
                </div>

                <div class="endpoint">
                    <div>
                        <span class="endpoint-method get">GET</span>
                        <span class="endpoint-path">/api/:name</span>
                    </div>
                    <p style="margin-top: 12px;">Get a specific IDL by program name or Solana wallet address.</p>
                    <h4>Path Parameters:</h4>
                    <ul>
                        <li><code>name</code>: Program name (e.g., "jupiter") or Solana wallet address</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h4>Example Requests:</h4>
                    <pre><code># Get by program name
curl http://localhost:3000/api/jupiter

# Get by Solana wallet address
curl http://localhost:3000/api/JUP6LkbZbjS1jKKwapdHNy74zcZ3tLUZoi5QNyVTaV4</code></pre>
                    <h4>Example Response:</h4>
                    <pre><code>{
  "name": "jupiter",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "description": "Jupiter Aggregator - The key liquidity aggregator for Solana",
  "category": "dex-aggregator",
  "address": "JUP6LkbZbjS1jKKwapdHNy74zcZ3tLUZoi5QNyVTaV4",
  "idl": {
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "name": "jupiter",
    "instructions": [
      {
        "name": "swap",
        "accounts": [...],
        "args": [...]
      }
    ],
    "accounts": [...],
    "types": [...],
    "errors": [...]
  }
}</code></pre>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/api/jupiter', null)" style="margin-top: 12px;">ğŸš€ Try It Live (Jupiter)</button>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/api/orca', null)" style="margin-top: 12px; background: var(--text-secondary);">ğŸš€ Try It Live (Orca)</button>
                </div>

                <div class="endpoint">
                    <div>
                        <span class="endpoint-method post">POST</span>
                        <span class="endpoint-path">/api/idl</span>
                    </div>
                    <p style="margin-top: 12px;">Create a new IDL record in the registry.</p>
                    <h4>Required Fields:</h4>
                    <ul>
                        <li><code>name</code>: Program name (e.g., "jupiter")</li>
                        <li><code>idl</code>: Complete IDL JSON object with version, name, instructions, accounts, types, etc.</li>
                        <li><code>address</code> (optional): Solana wallet address for the program</li>
                        <li><code>category</code> (optional): Program category (defi, dex, lending, etc.)</li>
                        <li><code>description</code> (optional): Program description</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h4>Example Request:</h4>
                    <pre><code>curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/idl \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "name": "myprogram",
    "address": "MyProg11111111111111111111111111111111111",
    "description": "My custom Solana program",
    "category": "defi",
    "idl": {
      "version": "0.1.0",
      "name": "my_program",
      "instructions": [
        {
          "name": "initialize",
          "accounts": [
            {
              "name": "user",
              "isMut": true,
              "isSigner": true
            }
          ],
          "args": []
        }
      ],
      "accounts": [],
      "types": [],
      "errors": []
    }
  }'</code></pre>
                    <h4>Example Response:</h4>
                    <pre><code>{
  "success": true,
  "message": "IDL created successfully",
  "data": {
    "name": "myprogram",
    "address": "MyProg11111111111111111111111111111111111",
    "version": "0.1.0"
  }
}</code></pre>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('POST', '/api/idl', {name:'test-program',address:'Test111111111111111111111111111111111111',description:'Test Program',category:'defi',idl:{version:'0.1.0',name:'test_program',instructions:[],accounts:[],types:[],errors:[]}})" style="margin-top: 12px;">ğŸš€ Try It Live</button>
                </div>

                <div class="endpoint">
                    <div>
                        <span class="endpoint-method get">GET</span>
                        <span class="endpoint-path">/api/search</span>
                    </div>
                    <p style="margin-top: 12px;">Search for programs using semantic search. This endpoint searches across program names, descriptions, and categories.</p>
                    <h4>Query Parameters:</h4>
                    <ul>
                        <li><code>q</code>: Search query (required) - e.g., "dex trading", "lending protocol", "liquid staking"</li>
                        <li><code>limit</code>: Number of results (default: 10, max: 50)</li>
                    </ul>
                    <h4>Example Request:</h4>
                    <pre><code>curl "http://localhost:3000/api/search?q=dex%20trading&limit=5"</code></pre>
                    <h4>Example Response:</h4>
                    <pre><code>{
  "query": "dex trading",
  "total": 5,
  "results": [
    {
      "id": "jupiter",
      "name": "Jupiter",
      "description": "Jupiter Aggregator - The key liquidity aggregator for Solana",
      "category": "dex-aggregator",
      "score": 0.95
    }
  ]
}</code></pre>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/api/search?q=dex&limit=5', null)" style="margin-top: 12px;">ğŸš€ Try It Live (Search "dex")</button>
                    <button class="playground-btn" onclick="testEndpoint('GET', '/api/search?q=lending&limit=5', null)" style="margin-top: 12px; background: var(--text-secondary);">ğŸš€ Try It Live (Search "lending")</button>
                </div>
            </div>

            <!-- MCP API Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="mcp-api">
                <h2>MCP API</h2>
                <p>
                    The Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides structured, high-performance access to IDL
                    schemas, symbol lookup, code generation, and diagnostics. Perfect for LLM integration and editor
                    tooling.
                </p>

                <h3>Features</h3>
                <ul>
                    <li>ğŸ“‹ Schema listing & retrieval</li>
                    <li>ğŸ” Symbol lookup (types, instructions, accounts, enums)</li>
                    <li>ğŸ’» Code generation (TypeScript, Rust, Python, Anchor TS)</li>
                    <li>âœ… IDL validation and diagnostics</li>
                    <li>ğŸš€ High performance (p95 &lt; 100ms)</li>
                    <li>ğŸ”Œ Multiple transports (stdio, WebSocket)</li>
                </ul>

                <h3 id="mcp-tools">MCP Tools</h3>

                <h4>list_schemas</h4>
                <p>List all available IDL schemas in the registry with optional filtering.</p>
                <pre><code>{
  "name": "list_schemas",
  "arguments": {
    "category": "dex",
    "status": "available"
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>get_schema</h4>
                <p>Retrieve a specific IDL schema by protocol ID.</p>
                <pre><code>{
  "name": "get_schema",
  "arguments": {
    "protocol_id": "jupiter"
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>lookup_symbol</h4>
                <p>Look up types, instructions, accounts, or enums in an IDL.</p>
                <pre><code>{
  "name": "lookup_symbol",
  "arguments": {
    "protocol_id": "jupiter",
    "symbol_name": "route",
    "symbol_type": "instruction"
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>generate_code</h4>
                <p>Generate code from an IDL for a specific target language/framework.</p>
                <pre><code>{
  "name": "generate_code",
  "arguments": {
    "protocol_id": "jupiter",
    "target": "typescript"
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>validate_idl</h4>
                <p>Validate an IDL schema and provide diagnostics.</p>
                <pre><code>{
  "name": "validate_idl",
  "arguments": {
    "protocol_id": "jupiter"
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h3 id="mcp-integration">Integration Examples</h3>

                <h4>Claude Desktop</h4>
                <pre><code>{
  "mcpServers": {
    "idlhub": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["/path/to/idlhub/mcp-server/src/index.js"],
      "env": {
        "IDL_REGISTRY_PATH": "/path/to/idlhub"
      }
    }
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>Cline / VSCode</h4>
                <pre><code>{
  "mcpServers": {
    "idlhub": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["${workspaceFolder}/mcp-server/src/index.js"]
    }
  }
}</code></pre>

                <h4>Custom Client (WebSocket)</h4>
                <pre><code>import WebSocket from 'ws';

const ws = new WebSocket('ws://localhost:8080');

ws.on('open', () => {
  ws.send(JSON.stringify({
    jsonrpc: '2.0',
    id: 1,
    method: 'tools/call',
    params: {
      name: 'list_schemas',
      arguments: { category: 'dex' }
    }
  }));
});

ws.on('message', (data) => {
  const response = JSON.parse(data);
  console.log(response);
});</code></pre>
            </div>

            <!-- API Playground Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="playground">
                <h2>API Playground</h2>
                <p>Test API endpoints interactively. Select an endpoint, customize the request, and see the response in
                    real-time. <strong>This makes actual HTTP requests to the API server.</strong></p>
                <p style="font-size: 12px; color: var(--text-muted); margin-bottom: 16px;">
                    <strong>âš ï¸ Important:</strong> The API playground requires a running API server. 
                    To use this feature, you must first <a href="#quick-start" style="color: var(--accent-primary);">set up and run the API server locally</a> 
                    at <code>http://localhost:3000</code>. The static site at <code>https://idlhub.com</code> does not include a backend API server.
                </p>

                <div class="playground">
                    <h3>Try It Out</h3>
                    <div class="playground-controls">
                        <select id="endpointSelect" class="playground-select">
                            <option value="GET:/api/all">GET /api/all - Get all IDLs</option>
                            <option value="GET:/api/jupiter">GET /api/jupiter - Get Jupiter IDL by name</option>
                            <option value="GET:/api/search">GET /api/search?q=dex - Search programs</option>
                            <option value="POST:/api/idl">POST /api/idl - Create new IDL</option>
                        </select>
                        <button class="playground-btn" onclick="executeRequest()">Execute</button>
                        <button class="playground-btn" onclick="clearPlayground()"
                            style="background: var(--text-muted);">Clear</button>
                    </div>

                    <div style="margin-bottom: 16px;">
                        <h4>Request Body (for POST requests):</h4>
                        <textarea id="requestBody" class="playground-input"
                            placeholder='Enter JSON request body here...'>{
  "programId": "example",
  "name": "Example Program",
  "category": "defi",
  "idl": {
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "name": "example",
    "instructions": []
  }
}</textarea>
                    </div>

                    <div>
                        <h4>Response:</h4>
                        <div id="playgroundOutput" class="playground-output">Response will appear here...</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>

            <!-- Code Examples Section -->
            <div class="doc-section" id="examples">
                <h2>Code Examples</h2>

                <h3>JavaScript/TypeScript</h3>
                <pre><code>// Fetch all IDLs
const response = await fetch('https://idlhub.com/api/all');
const data = await response.json();
console.log(data.idls);

// Get Jupiter IDL by name
const jupiterResponse = await fetch('https://idlhub.com/api/jupiter');
const jupiterData = await jupiterResponse.json();

// Use with Anchor
import { Program, AnchorProvider } from '@coral-xyz/anchor';
const program = new Program(jupiterData.idl, provider);</code></pre>

                <h3>Python</h3>
                <pre><code>import requests

# Fetch all IDLs
response = requests.get('https://idlhub.com/api/all')
idls = response.json()['idls']

# Get specific IDL by name
jupiter_response = requests.get('https://idlhub.com/api/jupiter')
jupiter_data = jupiter_response.json()
jupiter_idl = jupiter_data['idl']

# Search for protocols
search_response = requests.get('https://idlhub.com/api/search?q=lending&limit=5')
results = search_response.json()['results']</code></pre>

                <h3>Rust</h3>
                <pre><code>use reqwest;
use serde_json::Value;

#[tokio::main]
async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn std::error::Error>> {
    // Fetch Jupiter IDL by name
    let response = reqwest::get("https://idlhub.com/api/jupiter")
        .await?
        .json::<Value>()
        .await?;
    
    println!("Jupiter data: {}", serde_json::to_string_pretty(&response)?);
    Ok(())
}</code></pre>

                <h3>cURL Examples</h3>
                <pre><code># Get all IDLs
curl https://idlhub.com/api/all

# Get specific IDL by name
curl https://idlhub.com/api/jupiter

# Get IDL by Solana wallet address
curl https://idlhub.com/api/JUP6LkbZbjS1jKKwapdHNy74zcZ3tLUZoi5QNyVTaV4

# Search for DEX protocols
curl "https://idlhub.com/api/search?q=decentralized%20exchange&limit=10"

# Create a new IDL record
curl -X POST https://idlhub.com/api/idl \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "name": "myprogram",
    "address": "MyProg11111111111111111111111111111111111",
    "description": "My custom program",
    "category": "defi",
    "idl": {
      "version": "0.1.0",
      "name": "my_program",
      "instructions": []
    }
  }'</code></pre>
            </div>
        </div>

        <div class="footer">
            <p>idlhub.com - Open source IDL registry for the Solana ecosystem â€¢ <a
                    href="https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub" target="_blank">GitHub</a> â€¢ <a href="docs.html">Documentation</a></p>
        </div>
    </div>

    <script>
        // Theme management
        function toggleTheme() {
            const currentTheme = document.documentElement.getAttribute('data-theme');
            const newTheme = currentTheme === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark';
            document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', newTheme);
            localStorage.setItem('idlhub-theme', newTheme);
        }

        // Load saved theme
        const savedTheme = localStorage.getItem('idlhub-theme');
        if (savedTheme) {
            document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', savedTheme);
        }

        // Helper function to test endpoints directly from the docs
        async function testEndpoint(method, path, body) {
            const output = document.getElementById('playgroundOutput');
            if (!output) {
                // Display error message inline if possible, otherwise log to console
                if (document.getElementById('playground')) {
                    document.getElementById('playground').textContent = 'Error: Playground output element not found. Please ensure you are viewing the API Playground section.';
                } else {
                    console.error('Playground output element not found. Please ensure you are viewing the API Playground section.');
                }
                return;
            }
            
            // Scroll to playground
            document.getElementById('playground').scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
            
            output.textContent = 'Loading...';
            
            try {
                // Determine API endpoint based on environment
                const isLocalhost = window.location.hostname === 'localhost' || 
                                  window.location.hostname === '127.0.0.1';
                
                if (!isLocalhost) {
                    output.textContent = `âš ï¸ API Playground Not Available

The API playground requires a local API server to be running.

To use this feature:

1. Clone the repository:
   git clone https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub.git
   cd idlhub

2. Install dependencies:
   npm install

3. Start the API server:
   npm run api:start

4. Open docs.html locally at http://localhost:3000

The static site at https://idlhub.com does not include a backend API server.`;
                    return;
                }
                
                const apiBase = 'http://localhost:3000';
                const url = `${apiBase}${path}`;

                const options = {
                    method: method,
                    headers: {
                        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
                    }
                };

                if (method === 'POST' && body) {
                    options.body = JSON.stringify(body);
                }

                const response = await fetch(url, options);
                const contentType = response.headers.get('content-type') || '';
                let responseBody;
                if (contentType.includes('application/json')) {
                    try {
                        responseBody = await response.json();
                        output.textContent = JSON.stringify(responseBody, null, 2);
                    } catch (jsonError) {
                        // JSON parse failed, fallback to text
                        const text = await response.text();
                        output.textContent = `Invalid JSON response:\n${text}`;
                    }
                } else {
                    const text = await response.text();
                    output.textContent = text;
                }
            } catch (error) {
                output.textContent = `Error: ${error.message}

Make sure the API server is running locally:
1. npm install
2. npm run api:start
3. Server should be at http://localhost:3000`;
            }
        }

        // Sidebar active link tracking
        const sections = document.querySelectorAll('.doc-section');
        const sidebarLinks = document.querySelectorAll('.sidebar a');

        function updateActiveLink() {
            let currentSection = '';
            sections.forEach(section => {
                const sectionTop = section.offsetTop;
                const sectionHeight = section.clientHeight;
                if (window.pageYOffset >= sectionTop - 100) {
                    currentSection = section.getAttribute('id');
                }
            });

            sidebarLinks.forEach(link => {
                link.classList.remove('active');
                if (link.getAttribute('href') === `#${currentSection}`) {
                    link.classList.add('active');
                }
            });
        }

        window.addEventListener('scroll', updateActiveLink);
        window.addEventListener('load', updateActiveLink);

        // API Playground functionality - Makes real API calls to the server
        async function executeRequest() {
            const select = document.getElementById('endpointSelect');
            const output = document.getElementById('playgroundOutput');
            const requestBody = document.getElementById('requestBody').value;
            const [method, path] = select.value.split(':');

            output.textContent = 'Loading...';

            try {
                // Determine API endpoint based on environment
                const isLocalhost = window.location.hostname === 'localhost' || 
                                  window.location.hostname === '127.0.0.1';
                
                if (!isLocalhost) {
                    output.textContent = `âš ï¸ API Playground Not Available

The API playground requires a local API server to be running.

To use this feature:

1. Clone the repository:
   git clone https://github.com/openSVM/idlhub.git
   cd idlhub

2. Install dependencies:
   npm install

3. Start the API server:
   npm run api:start

4. Open docs.html locally at http://localhost:3000

The static site at https://idlhub.com does not include a backend API server.`;
                    return;
                }
                
                const apiBase = 'http://localhost:3000';
                const url = `${apiBase}${path}`;

                const options = {
                    method: method,
                    headers: {
                        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
                    }
                };

                if (method === 'POST' && requestBody) {
                    options.body = requestBody;
                }

                const response = await fetch(url, options);
                const data = await response.json();

                output.textContent = JSON.stringify(data, null, 2);
            } catch (error) {
                output.textContent = `Error: ${error.message}

Make sure the API server is running locally:
1. npm install
2. npm run api:start
3. Server should be at http://localhost:3000`;
            }
        }

        function clearPlayground() {
            document.getElementById('playgroundOutput').textContent = 'Response will appear here...';
            document.getElementById('requestBody').value = '';
        }

        // Update request body visibility based on method
        document.getElementById('endpointSelect').addEventListener('change', function() {
            const [method] = this.value.split(':');
            const requestBodyContainer = document.getElementById('requestBody').parentElement;
            
            if (method === 'POST') {
                requestBodyContainer.style.display = 'block';
            } else {
                requestBodyContainer.style.display = 'none';
            }
        });

        // Initialize
        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            const [method] = document.getElementById('endpointSelect').value.split(':');
            const requestBodyContainer = document.getElementById('requestBody').parentElement;
            
            if (method !== 'POST') {
                requestBodyContainer.style.display = 'none';
            }
        });
    </script>
</body>

</html>

```

## File: index.html
```
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>idlhub.com - Solana IDL Registry</title>
    <style>
        :root {
            /* Light Theme (Default) */
            --bg-primary: #f5f5f5;
            --bg-secondary: #ffffff;
            --bg-tertiary: #f6f8fa;
            --text-primary: #24292f;
            --text-secondary: #57606a;
            --text-muted: #8b949e;
            --border-primary: #24292f;
            --border-secondary: #d0d7de;
            --accent-primary: #0969da;
            --accent-hover: #24292f;
            --error-color: #cf222e;
            --selection-bg: #0969da;
            --checkbox-bg: #ffffff;
        }

        [data-theme="dark"] {
            --bg-primary: #0d1117;
            --bg-secondary: #161b22;
            --bg-tertiary: #21262d;
            --text-primary: #c9d1d9;
            --text-secondary: #8b949e;
            --text-muted: #6e7681;
            --border-primary: #30363d;
            --border-secondary: #21262d;
            --accent-primary: #58a6ff;
            --accent-hover: #1f6feb;
            --error-color: #f85149;
            --selection-bg: #1f6feb;
            --checkbox-bg: #161b22;
        }

        [data-theme="night"] {
            --bg-primary: #0f0f23;
            --bg-secondary: #1a1a3e;
            --bg-tertiary: #252550;
            --text-primary: #ccccff;
            --text-secondary: #9999ff;
            --text-muted: #6666cc;
            --border-primary: #9966ff;
            --border-secondary: #252550;
            --accent-primary: #ff6ec7;
            --accent-hover: #ffcc00;
            --error-color: #ff3366;
            --selection-bg: #ff6ec7;
            --checkbox-bg: #1a1a3e;
        }

        [data-theme="terminal"] {
            --bg-primary: #000000;
            --bg-secondary: #0a0a0a;
            --bg-tertiary: #121212;
            --text-primary: #00ff00;
